greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Determinant of the square matrix whose rows are the cyclic permutations of the digits of n.
link: David A. Corneth, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
formula: for n = ab, det(M) = a^2 - b^2;
for n = abc, det(M) = 3abc - a^3 - b^3 - c^3; ...
example: for n=104, the (3 X 3) matrix M is
program: M = Matrix(lambda i,j: d[(i+j) % len(d)], nrows=len(d))
(PARI) a(n) = {if(n<10, return(n)); my(d = digits(n), m, s); d = concat(d, d); s = #d/2; m = matrix(s, s, i, j, d[i+j-1]); matdet(m)} \\ _David A. Corneth_, Jun 12 2017
xref: Coincides with A257587 for the first 100 terms, but differs thereafter.
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Dec 15 2010
